TopicTitle: [1.2.0] Precise Node 1.2.4 - Precisely edit your maneuver nodes

Articles.Content: Awesome! Thanks!

Why was the apoapsis and periapsis removed from the UI? (as seen in the screenshot on page 1)

This was a main reason for me to download this. To not have to mouse over the PA / AP points to see both values during node creation.
Why would any sane person remove that?

Why was the apoapsis and periapsis removed from the UI? (as seen in the screenshot on page 1)

This was a main reason for me to download this. To not have to mouse over the PA / AP points to see both values during node creation.

Why would any sane person remove that?

You had me questioning my sanity there for a minute:

Why was the apoapsis and periapsis removed from the UI? (as seen in the screenshot on page 1)

This was a main reason for me to download this. To not have to mouse over the PA / AP points to see both values during node creation.

Are you referring to the apoapsis and periapsis being shown in the Precise Node UI in the screenshot on the first page of this thread, but no longer there, as in the screenshot in the last post?

Wait what?!

... Thank God. I though it was missing in the latest version. But no, I have the latest version and Ap/Pe enabled in the options. All that is needed is hitting the "O" button and enable it.

Wait what?!

... Thank God. I though it was missing in the latest version. But no, I have the latest version and Ap/Pe enabled in the options. All that is needed is hitting the "O" button and enable it.

Hey, cool, I didn't realize that. Of course, I use KER, so I don't need that info from Precise Node, but it's nice to know it's an option.
To clear up any confusion: Display of apoapsis and periapsis exists since Precise Node 0.4, and is still in.

Hey, cool, I didn't realize that. Of course, I use KER, so I don't need that info from Precise Node, but it's nice to know it's an option.

KER gives you information on the resultant Ap and Pe from a maneuver node?

Tried installing and I haven't been able to get it to work. Even tried on a completely clean version with no other mods.

I have to assume I'm installing it wrong. I placed the folder I unzipped in the Gamedata folder.

I'm still new to all of this mod stuff so I'm sure it's on me. Any help would be appreciated.

Yeah, that's how it works. You unzip and copy into your GameData folder. You should end up having one folder called PreciseNode and inside that, one called plugins and 2 files CHANGES.txt and LICENSE.txt.

Also, note that PN window shows up in map view only and only when you have a node created.

KER gives you information on the resultant Ap and Pe from a maneuver node?

Yep! Now that I have it turned on, I am really liking it, too! Having that visible helped yesterday when I was setting up a maneuver node to get to 2868750m over Kerbin. Nice!

There are loads of exceptions in my log?

Can't say I have seen these errors before.

There are loads of exceptions in my log?

I think you'll need to provide more details. I'd suggest following the instructions here and, if the troubleshooting steps don't fix it, then provide the reporting steps to provide info as they suggest.

(Also, if you fix it, and you know what fixed it, it's useful to pass on that info, too.)

I think you'll need to provide more details.

I do not have a lot of details really. Just noticed that the exception detector window staid open and one counter was about to pass 10,000 in one line. The log was over 90MB already (made a copy, but do I dare uploading it all ... I can do it if you like of course) and full of the lines I gave an excerpt of.

Also there was an artifact on the screen where the PreciseNode window usually is in my game, although it also was visible in the flight view.

What fixed it - a relaunch really and I do not have a clue how to reproduce it since it just happened that one session without any real impact on the game (thank you SSD?).

What fixed it - a relaunch really and I do not have a clue how to reproduce it since it just happened that one session without any real impact on the game (thank you SSD?).

Unfortunately, if you can't reproduce it, it will very difficult for anyone to troubleshoot the issue. On the other hand, if it doesn't happen to you again, it's not as much of a problem for you, right?
blizzy78, I've create new pull request on github. The changes add inclination to orbit information. Please consider accept it.
Thanks, I've seen it. Will check it out over the next few days.
Who tested version 1.13 with KSP 1.03? Do it work correctly?

Who tested version 1.13 with KSP 1.03? Do it work correctly?

I am using it with 1.04 successfully. I got a compatibility message on start up but it seems to function just fine otherwise.
Is there any way to simply remove the key bindings for precise node? They only get in the way of my prefered control scheme.

Is there any way to simply remove the key bindings for precise node? They only get in the way of my prefered control scheme.

yes , you can go in\Kerbal Space Program\GameData\PreciseNode\plugins\PluginData\PreciseNode,

and modify this file config.xml with notepad

at the line <string name="hideWindow">P</string>, you can try to change the "P" by "none" or anything you want.

for the feed-back, it works well in 1.0.4 but there is still the warning on launch screen.

one feature i would love is to save and restore a set of node per vessel.
Am I missing something obvious or does PreciseNode still not support Kerbin time? My game is set in Kerbin time but PreciseNode is not showing matching figures.

Am I missing something obvious or does PreciseNode still not support Kerbin time? My game is set in Kerbin time but PreciseNode is not showing matching figures.

It is supposed to honor the game setting (this feature came in 0.11), but I've found it is stuck in 24h/365d mode even when the game is using 6h/426d mode, too.
